thread.title: Be prepared for Big Sam effect, warns Tony Pulis
thread.title_full: Be prepared for Big Sam effect, warns Tony Pulis

title: Be prepared for Big Sam effect, warns Tony Pulis
text:
Tweet 
The Hammers sit sixth in the Premier League table after a storming start, whereas the Black Cats are 19th, and without a win. 
Dudley-born Allardyce was officially unveiled as the Sunderland manager yesterday, and now has just a few days to turn his team into one that can trouble Albion, and Pulis doesn’t doubt that he will. 
“I know Sam well,” said the Baggies manager. “I don’t think he gets the credit he deserves. 
“He did a smashing job at West Ham and you know his teams are always well drilled and well organised. 
“People forget that when they got relegated, he got them promoted in the first year and they kicked on from there. 
“He laid down the groundwork for the next manager who is reaping the rewards.” What do you think? Log in and start commenting 
Although the appointment is undoubtedly good news for fans of the red and white, it couldn’t have come at a worse time for those following blue and white stripes. 
In dire need of a win, and perhaps more importantly, a performance with some attacking intent, what looked like a less taxing return to Premier League action after the international break just got a lot harder. Big Sam doesn’t have a lot of time to work with his players, but then neither does Albion chief Pulis. 
Today is the first time this week he’s seen the majority of his team, and some players are not returning until tomorrow or Friday. 
Allardyce, who started his managerial career at The Hawthorns with a spell as Brian Talbot’s assistant, has a mouthwatering derby against his old club, Newcastle, next. More on this story:
